cab.content: Circulated to the War Cabinet by the Secretary of State for India.N7240G^S^ From Viceroy, Home Department, Qlh May 1919.(Received 11 a.m., 10th May.)Secretary of State' Following is in continuation of Home Department telegram dated 7th May : - No further disturbances reported in Punjab. Further snowball postcards have been found addressed either to Hindus or Mohammedans or both. Hissar reports that two student agitators are attempting to stir up disaffection among Jats. Agitation and spreading of false rumours continue. Quiet continues elsewhere. Mohammedan situation as before. According to report from Afghan source, Indian agitators have pledged themselves to incendiarism and attack on mechanical transport and aircraft. It is reported that Gandhi will order another black Sunday on 11th May. .OT 10875 6/19
